titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Roswell B. Perkins papers FA1851

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 18:28:49 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: 25 containers: 23 legal document boxes, and 2 letter document boxes

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: All rights including title, copyright and literary rights were transferred to the RAC upon the donation of the collection in 2021.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Roswell B. Perkins papers were donated to the RAC by Susan Perkins in 2021.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Roswell B. Perkins papers largely contain political files that were used by Perkins to give counsel to Nelson Rockefeller throughout his campaign for governorship. The files contain information about both Democrat and Republican political parties and their position on major issues of interest. The files contain in-depth analysis of the Republican platform, New York State politics, and the 1960 and 1968 presidential elections. Also included in the collection is correspondence, speeches, press releases, election memorabilia, and books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics: government closest to the people, the job crisis (20 million new jobs), education for all Americans, urban America, older Americans and Social Security, conservation and effective use of natural resources, combatting crime, Communism, Cuba, Latin America, the Space Program, Southeast Asia, Vietnam, Malaysian-Indonesian crisis, NATO, trade with Communist Bloc, defense, and United Nations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics: Republican Convention of 1960, current assignments, Republican National Committee 1959, intelligence summary, polls, state Republican committee, and publicity.
